results.title: So much to give: a report from Anne Deveson
results.creator_credit: Betti Wood, Warwick Olson and Pilgrim Productions
results.brief_description: Seeks to develop community awareness of the needs of mentally handicapped children. Shows interviews with parents, teachers, doctors and social workers involved with these children. Script and voice - Anne Deveson.

results.title: So good to share
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Cinevex and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Features wine and winemaking in the Barossa Valley of South Australia by German settlers in 1836. First grapes planted 1847, harvested in 1850. Views of grape picking, pressing and storage. The film shows the general life around the area.

results.title: So far from India
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair and Mira Nair Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary of the complex rhythm of middle class family life in a town in India. Tension occurs when the man, who has immigrated to New York fails to send for his family. He returns home to find many problems facing him.
results.description: A documentary of the complex rhythm of middle class family life in a town in India. Tension occurs when the man, who has immigrated to New York fails to send for his family. He returns home to find many problems facing him.

results.title: Snowy Mountain Scheme
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
This short film shows the early stages of the Hydro Electric Scheme. Illustrating the difficulties in development and construction through diagrammatic animation. This film was probably shot and completed before the scheme was finished.

results.title: Snowdrift at Bleath Gill
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A freight train becomes snowbound in the West-Morland hills in Northern England. The Motive Power, Operating and Engineering Departments of British Transport go to work with snow-ploughs to reach the trapped train. Working through the night the team dig clear, and thaw out moving parts, and finally two engines help to clear the line.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Idloes Owen, Horace Shepherd, British Council and Inspiration Pictures (GB)
results.brief_description: Some of the loveliest scenery in Wales; the view from the summit of Snowden, historic Conway Castel, the Swallow Falls. Shots of Caeruaroon Castle include the Kings Gate, the ruined Banqueting Hall and the Eagle Tower where the Welsh flag and the Union Jack fly side by side.

results.title: Snowdon on camera. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Iain Johnstone and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. He emphasises the importance of the eye rather than the camera and challenges the claim that photography requires complicated equipment and lighting. He also discusses the value of photographs to different people.
results.description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him.
